meta_description: The Museum of Arts & Sciences (MOAS) is the primary art, science and history museum in Central Florida.
hours_text:
Lowell and Nancy Lohman Family

# Planetarium

## **Bringing space down to Earth.**

Lift off and explore the universe in Daytona Beach’s hub for all things Space! The Museum of Arts & Sciences is home to the Lowell & Nancy Lohman Planetarium: A state-of-the-art facility where science, art, and technology blend seamlessly to create an experience that is out of this World!

Join us as we reveal the beauty of Central Florida’s sky and connect guests to the exploration of space, taking flight from our own backyard! Whether you visit the Lohman Planetarium as part of your day at MOAS (Museum of Arts & Sciences) or are joining us for a unique event, there are plenty of programs that will capture your imagination. Experience a tour of the _Sky Tonight_ taught by one of our world-class educators, a fascinating talk from a renowned scientist, or even a live rocket launch, shown in our newly renovated lobby. At night, the planetarium comes alive, with stunning laser rock spectacles featuring all your favorite music, unique live concert events under a canopy of stars, movie nights in 4K, and exclusive one-off events you do not want to miss!

_“The Lohman Planetarium strives to serve as a cornerstone of science, scholarship, and culture in central Florida. With the planetarium as our window into the Universe, we hope to inspire all ages to look beyond the stars and keep wondering!”_

352 South Nova Road  
Daytona Beach, FL 32114  
[View Map](https://www.google.com/maps/place/352%20South...
admission_text:
# Visit

Welcome!

**Boardwalk Closed**  
As part of the Museum of Arts & Sciences’ ongoing campus transformation and expansion, the boardwalk is being reimagined to better serve our campus and community.

While the boardwalk is under redesign, the Garden Club of the Halifax Country will continue to care for and maintain the garden, ensuring it remains a beautiful and vibrant space for all to enjoy.

We look forward to unveiling the redesigned boardwalk as part of our exciting future plans.

See ‘**[What is Still Open at MOAS’](https://www.moasfuture.org/post/transformation-in-progress-what-you-can-still-experience)** on **[MOASFuture.org](https://www.moasfuture.org/)** for details.

**Explore the Future of the Museum**  
We’re excited to share the vision for the next chapter of our museum’s journey. Stay up-to-date on how upcoming construction will enhance our spaces, expand our facilities, and create a more dynamic experience for visitors. Visit [MOAS Future](https://www.moasfuture.org/) to learn more about how we’re shaping the future of art, science, and history.

Getting Here

Welcome to the Museum of Arts & Sciences (MOAS)! We look forward to your visit. The Museum has a wide range of permanent collections including American, Cuban, and Florida artwork. Explore a large collection of Americana including one of the largest collections of Coca-Cola memorabilia in the world. Special Current Exhibits

Expedition: Dinosaur 

Experience favorite Dinosaurs like Dilophosaurus, Velociraptor, and more.

[More Info](/Expedition--Dinosaur-6-26994.html)

It's a Ship Show: Florida's Maritime Canvas 

Embark on a visual voyage through the rich maritime history of Florida’s waterways, as depicted in a stunning collection of ship paintings.

[More Info](/It-s-a-Ship-Show--Florida-s-Maritime-Canvas-6-26787.html)

Shoosty Bugs: An Art Infestation 

Digital creations that demonstrate the artist’s innovative fusion of metamorphic insects inhabiting lengths of color-saturated silks.

[More Info](/Shoosty-Bugs--An-Art-Infestation-6-26788.html)

Tide Pool: Exploring Coastal Communities 

Dive into the mesmerizing realm of the world's oceans through this exhibit that showcases some of the Museum's most interesting marine specimens.

[More Info](/Tide-Pool--Exploring-Coastal-Communities-6-26043.html)

Bugs Outside the Box
